page.title: 03Court Gardens
page.content: There are about 16{bungalows}and they were built in 1964 and 1965. They were built on Stanton Court's ground by a man called{Bill Kew.}Stanton did not have any main drainage until 1971 when they laid it for the service station. Before that it smelt. The bungalows were built on an orchard and Mr and Mrs King owned it. Mr Bill Kew came from Dunley near Bristol. He sold 12 and a quarter acres which were building plots one by one, he built them by order as plots were sold. He was a small builder, he sub-contracted plumbing, plastering and heating. The first bungalow he built was the one on the corner, he built it for a show house and he lived in it. Mr Kew later moved to Kington Langley. When he had completed the 12 bungalows most were purchased by{RAF}officers.
